intro: Adenocalymma subsessilifolium var. tephrinocalyx, commonly known as the narrow-leafed adenocalymma, is a species of flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a shrub characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. Its flowers are usually pale yellow or greenish in color, and it produces small, round fruits. The species is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and ecological adaptations.
